item.title: Cellulosic Ethanol Development and Implementation Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Air Quality.

item.text: Read the second time and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S164-165)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S164)

summary.text:
Cellulosic Ethanol Development and Implementation Act of 2007 - Amends the Clean Air Act to direct the Secretary of Energy to establish: (1) a grants program for eligible entities to implement research, development, and demonstration projects relating to the use of cellulosic ethanol fuel for motor vehicles; and (2) a pilot program to provide grants to eligible entities for use in installing infrastructure (such as pumps) that would enable retail gas stations to sell and dispense ethanol fuel.

Requires an eligible entity to provide matching funds in the amount of 20% of the total amount of the grant.

bill.title: Cellulosic Ethanol Development and Implementation Act of 2007

item.title: A bill to amend the Clean Air Act to require the Secretary of Energy to provide grants to eligible entities to carry out research, development, and demonstration projects of cellulosic ethanol and construct infrastructure that enables retail gas stations to dispense cellulosic ethanol for vehicle fuel to reduce the consumption of petroleum-based fuel.
Cellulosic Ethanol Development and Implementation Act of 2007
Cellulosic Ethanol Development and Implementation Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Read the second time and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S164-165)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
